title: Tomb Raider TV Series Adds Another Big Name To Its Cast
description: Prime Video's Tomb Raider TV series continues to add to its cast, with a new report saying Jason Isaacs will star in the show. Deadline reported that the Emmy-nominated actor will appear in the show, but his role is unknown at this point, as is the larger story for the series. Isaacs is a veteran actor perhaps best known for his role as Lucius Malfoy in the Harry Potter movie series. He's also had roles in the movies The Patriot, Black Hawk Down, Peter Pan, and Fury. On TV, Isaacs recently had a starring role in the The White Lotus Season 3, a role that earned him his first Emmy nomination. The Tomb Raider TV show stars Game of Thrones alum Sophie Turner as Lara Croft, with Avatar's Sigourney Weaver signed on to play a character named Wallace. British actor Martin Bobb-Semple will appear in the show, too, in an unspecified series regular role. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Perfect Dark Star Reacts To The Game's Cancellation
description: Recently, it was announced that Alix Wilton-Regan will take over for Camila Luddington in the role of Lara Croft for the next two games in the series. In a new interview, she said she is afraid that it may all fall apart after the last game she was set to appear in, the Perfect Dark reboot, was canceled. Wilton-Regan told TheGamer that she was filming her scenes as Joanna Dark for the Perfect Dark game at the same time she was shooting Lara for the new Tomb Raider games. It was "wonderful and genuinely one of the most creatively exciting times of my life." However, she said she was and remains concerned that Tomb Raider could fall apart, given that Perfect Dark was canceled. "I just felt so relieved that I still had Lara, but I also felt really frightened about losing Lara. I'm still frightened of losing Lara," she said. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Naughty Dog's Intergalactic Aiming For Mid-2027 Release Amid New Crunch Allegations - Report
description: A new report claims that Naughty Dog recently mandated that workers return to the office five days per week--up from three--and had been pushing staff to work "long hours" to get a demo of Intergalactic: The Heretic Prophet ready to show off to Sony higher-ups. The Bloomberg report said that beginning in late October, Naughty Dog asked staff to work "a minimum of eight extra hours a week" and document their overtime in a spreadsheet. "This overtime period was an attempt to get the production back on track after several missed deadlines," the report said. Workers were told to not work more than 60 hours per week, the report said. The return-to-office mandate was disruptive to some workers who reportedly had to find cover for childcare and their pets. The report added that the "mandated overtime" period wrapped up this week with the completion of the demo. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Fortnite Winterfest 2025: All Quests And Rewards
description: Fortnite's latest Winterfest celebration kicked off with the usual array of map and gameplay changes in Battle Royale and piles of free stuff in the Winterfest cabin. But that's not all there is to care about in Fortnite's latest update--we've also got a pair of new sets of quests that reward XP, and an additional free cosmetic that must be earned by completing a specific one of those new quests. Let's take a look at what we've got here. Table of Contents [hide] Winterfest 2025 quests Drop 1Collect a Perfect Gift from a chest Winterfest 2025 quests The first of these new quests sets, listed under Winterfest in your quest log, are for Battle Royale. There are four time-gated groups of this set of quests--the first group is available now, and the rest will be added every two days until they're all there. Completing a quest awards 12K XP each, and there may be a reward at the end of the questline--but we don't know for sure yet. These quests expire when Winterfest ends on January 5. Drop 1 Collect a Perfect Gift from a chest Every chest you open during Winterfest has a change to drop an item called Perfect Gift, which triggers a quest to deliver it to any non-hostile NPC on the map within five minutes. But for this quest, you just have to collect the item. Fortunately, the Perfect Gift does not require one of your inventory slots. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Arc Raiders Dev Looks Back On Game's Huge Launch, Says "The Work Is Just Beginning"
description: It's impossible to deny the success of Embark Studios' extraction shooter Arc Raiders. Now, as 2025 comes to a close, the studio is reflecting on the momentous launch, which was recently capped off by the title's win for Best Multiplayer Game at the 2025 Game Awards, and what's to come in 2026. If you're to believe Embark, which seems on top of the world right now, "the work is just beginning." In a post to Arc Raiders website, the shooter's executive producer Aleksander Grondal writes, "We had a feeling that Arc Raiders was something special. Internally, we were having a blast playing it before release, and your reaction to the tech test in April gave us an inkling of what was to come. What we didn't count on was the sheer scale of love and passion you guys were going to show this game." Arc Raiders, which was released in late October, became a smash hit right out of the gate, selling millions of copies within days and solidifying itself as one of the most-beloved multiplayer games of the year. Though many multiplayer games enjoy a surge of popularity that eventually relents, Arc Raiders has held on impressively long. As of this writing, its Steam numbers alone are still in the six-digit realm. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: GTA 5 Is Giving Players Free Gifts For Logging On During The Holiday
description: The new weekly update for Grand Theft Auto Online adds festive content, free gifts, discounts, and popular holiday modes. Rockstar Games also confirms snow will arrive in Los Santos later in the month. The holidays arrive in Los Santos with several returning modes players can participate in. These festive limited-time modes include GTA Online's Yeti Hunt, The Gooch, Weazel Plaza Shootout, and Snowball Fights. Additionally, players can expect snowy weather conditions to arrive later in the month. Players who log in to GTA Online anytime between December 23 and January 7 will receive an assortment of holiday freebies. These gifts include new items like the Season's Greetings Sweater, as well as returning favorites, such as the Snowball Launcher, Candy Cane, and Firework Launcher. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Dispatch Took "GTA 6 Amounts of Time" To Make, But Season 2 May Not Take Nearly As Long
description: Dispatch feels like the kind of game that must have always been headed for success, having sold a million copies in just 10 days, and while it missed most of the awards season, it still landed on several best-of lists for the year. That impression hides a much rougher reality. Dispatch took years longer than expected, nearly collapsed more than once, and only made it out because the team managed to survive long enough to finish it. "We're taking GTA 6 amounts of time on this shit," writer and co-founder Pierre Shorette says in an interview with Eurogamer, explaining why Dispatch Season 1 took so long to make. The episodic superhero workplace comedy spent close to seven years in development. The time spent wasn't about endlessly refining a hit, but about dealing with lost funding, shifting plans, and simple survival. The upside is that the groundwork is now done, meaning a potential Season 2 would not need anything close to the same amount of time. Game director Nick Herman is blunt about how close Dispatch came to ending. "We had a publisher who dropped us halfway through because of … financial things," he says. Shorette places that moment in the context of the wider industry collapse. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: 8BitDo Pro 3 Bluetooth Controller Gets Huge Discount At Amazon
description: 8BitDo Pro 3 Bluetooth Controller $50.39 (was $70) | For Switch 2, Switch, PC/Mac, Mobile, SteamOS See at Amazon Amazon is offering limited-time discounts on the superb 8BitDo Pro 3 Bluetooth Gamepad ahead of the holidays. If you're eligible for the bonus coupon discount, the GameCube-inspired purple and gray models are on sale for $50.39 and $50.37, respectively. This is the all-time best price for the Pro 3. Even the $55 deal on the G Classic model is slightly better than Amazon's Black Friday deal ($56). The Pro 3 is bundled with a matching charging stand, an extra set of Super Famicom-themed buttons, two sets of sticks, a USB-C charging cable, and a USB-C wireless receiver that can be stored in the charging dock. All of the Pro 3 Gamepad deals are shipped directly from Amazon, but each color is discounted by two sellers (Amazon and 8BitDo) with separate listings. Only Amazon is offering the extra coupon discounts, but we expect these deals to sell out fast. In case that happens, the button at the top of this story leads you to an Amazon page with all of the deals on the Pro 3. Purple -- $50.39 ($70) with coupon Gray -- $50.37 ($70) with coupon G Classic -- $55 ($70) The Pro 3 has 2.4GHz Wireless and Bluetooth support on Nintendo Switch, Switch 2, and PC. It's also compatible over Bluetooth on Steam Deck, Apple devices, and Android smartphones and tablets. Numerous enhancements and impactful new features make the Pro 3 a worthwhile upgrade, including including four extra remappable buttons, TMR joysticks, trigger locks, magnetic face buttons. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Larian CEO Says "A Lot Has Been Lost In Translation" Amid Divinity's AI Blowback
description: It has been a big week for Larian Studios, which just announced its upcoming RPG Divinity to tons of fervor. Unfortunately, a lot of the week since the announcement has consisted of members of the studio, including its CEO Swen Vincke, fighting online about the team's current attitude towards AI tools in games development following an interview with Bloomberg. Now, after a week of backlash, Larian is hoping to clear some of the air around Divinity and its use of AI. In a statement shared on Twitter, Vincke writes, "It's been a week since we announced Divinity, our next RPG, and a lot has become lost in translation." It’s been a week since we announced Divinity, our next RPG, and a lot has become lost in translation.Larian’s DNA is agency. Everything we work towards is to the benefit of our teams, games, and players. A better work day, and a better game. Our successes come from empowering… — Swen Vincke @where? (@LarAtLarian) December 18, 2025 Vincke continues, "Larian's DNA is agency. Everything we work towards is to the benefit of our teams, games, players. A better work day, and a better game. Our successes come from empowering people to work in their own way and bring the best out of their skill & craft, so that we can make the best RPGs we can possible make." Continue Reading at GameSpot
